newsitem.title: FRANCE: MATIF plans to extend use of GLOBEX as back-up.
newsitem.headline: MATIF plans to extend use of GLOBEX as back-up.

text.p: French financial futures exchange MATIF said on Friday it planned to extend the use of the GLOBEX electronic trading system as an emergency back-up to open outcry trading.
In a statement MATIF said that as of November it would use GLOBEX trading whenever open outcry transactions were disrupted as a result of force majeure.
The use of GLOBEX as an emergency back-up was limited until now to certain hours because GLOBEX trading was closed between 0900 GMT and 1300 GMT for maintenance.
GLOBEX trading will now be closed for maintenance between 2000 GMT and 0500 GMT.
The change will not penalise GLOBEX transactions because the bulk of volume was traded from 0500 GMT until the start of open outcry and from the end of open outcry until 2000 GMT.

Open outcry trading is from 0630 GMT until 1400 GMT for the Pibor three-month future and option, from 0700 GMT until 1430 GMT for the notionnel bond future and option and the Ecu long-term contract and from 0800 GMT until 1500 GMT for the CAC-40 future.
